details:
BURN
Log Result
Leaderboard
STRONG: Lower Body
3 alternating sets of:
A1.
6-8 Front Squats
Rest as needed
A2.
18 B-Stance Barbell Hip Thrusts
- Reps are dropping again this week, so try to increase the weights if we can.
- Hip Thrusts to be done as 9 reps each leg.
Start a set every 3 minutes
B.E90s x 3 Rounds
0:00 - 1:30

12 Box Step Downs (3-4s down each rep) Weighted if possible

1:30 - 3:00

15/12 Cal Erg

3:00 - 4:30

16m Sled Push
- Box Step downs to be done as 6/6 do all on 1 side first.
- Scale Erg Cals as needed.
- Can have the class start at different stations if you need to
C.AMRAP 8
15 Goblet Squats (3211 Tempo)
20 Reverse Crunches
20 Banded Glute Kickbacks
- Keep to the tempo on the squats even if it means you have to use less weight.
- Glute Kickbacks:
https://youtu.be/jBmarLD4Nog?si=jmVeWDHn-Vhu_2IH
Show less

FIT
Log Result
Leaderboard
Phase 1: Week 3 (A)
A.PRIMER
Snatch Balance
3 sets of 3 reps
Rest as needed
- Just an opportunity to get some practice dropping under the bar and trying to make that more comfortable
B.Every 2 minutes, for 10 minutes (5 sets):
2 Power Snatches + 1 Hang Power Snatch
- Still working on the complexes this week, try to build on what we did last snatch session and get more comfortable hanging onto that bar for reps 2/3.
- These are powers but if you want to squat snatch the hang that is a good opportunity to practice that!
C.DIANE
21-15-9 Reps for Time:
Deadlift @ 100/70 kg
Handstand Push-Up
- One of the OG classics.
- This is a tougher workout than you think. Try to stay in control and move with purpose as you work through this.
- Scale the HSPU - Piked / HRPU
- Make sure that BB isn't anywhere near a max, this should be no more than 75% of your 1RM
Show less

FIT
Log Result
Leaderboard
Phase 1: Week 3 (A)
A.PRIMER
Every 90 seconds, for 4:30 (3 sets):
2 Tall Split Jerks - Forehead/Chin/Chests
- Similar to the tall snatches recently, this is a way to try and practice getting under the bar and moving the jerks properly.

B.Every 2 minutes, for 10 minutes (5 sets):
Power Clean + Jerk + Hang Power Clean + Jerk
- Slightly easier complex than the last clean complex.
- Should be a good amount of time under tension here, but also a chance to connect reps and focus on how we are moving.
- Try and move that bar smoothly from OH back to the hang.
C.FOR TIME:
200 - 400 - 600 - 800m
Run

* After each Run

9 Hang Power Cleans (60/40)
6 S2OH (60/40)
Scoring
Time (lower is better)
Time Cap: 16 minutes
- This is going to be a good challenge for the runner vs the weightlifter.
- Push too hard on the run and the Bar is going to get very heavy very fast, but can you make up time on bigger sets with the BB.
- Pick a moderate weight for this one, shouldn't be crazy heavy but should challenge in the later rounds.
Show less

Log Result
Leaderboard
Phase 1 Week 3A
Warm Up
View Warm Up
A.Hang Snatch
5 sets of 2 reps @ 70-72.5%
Rest as needed
7RPE
Percentage off your squat snatch.
You can choose btw power or squat snatch!
B.Push Press
4 sets of 5 reps @ 65-70%
Rest as needed
6.5-7RPE
- Touch n go for reps. However if re-racking and drive had issues, reset each rep.
3 alternating sets of:
C1.
10-12 Double Dumbbell Romanian Deadlifts
Rest as needed
C2.
10 Banded Pallof Presses
7RPE for the RDL's
10/10 Pallof press.
Rest as needed

STEAM
Log Result
Leaderboard
Workout Wednesdays
A.As Many Rounds and Reps as possible in 12 minutes:
BikeErg 24/18 calories
21 Gorilla Box Jump Overs
16 Dumbbell Hang Power Clean and Jerks @ 15/10 kg
- Start slow on the 12 Minutes here.
- Big sets of work so we are going to need to grind through this one.
- 2 Dbs on the HC+J
Rest 3 minutes
B.As Many Rounds and Reps as possible in 9 minutes:
BikeErg 16/12 calories
15 Gorilla Box Jump Overs
12 Dumbbell Hang Clean and Jerks
- As the time lowers so do the reps, try to increase speed here.
Rest 3 minutes
C.As Many Rounds and Reps as possible in 6 minutes:
BikeErg 8/6 calories
9 Gorilla Box Jump Overs
8 Dumbbell Hang Clean and Jerks
- Final push reps are very manageable now. Try to push hard to finish.
Show less

BURN
Log Result
Leaderboard
MOVE: Upper Body
A.Every 3:30 for 10:30 (3 rounds):
12-15 Dumbbell Incline Bench Presses
10-12 Feet Elevated Inverted Ring Rows
12-15 Dumbbell Lateral Raises
- If you need to keep feet on the floor for the ring rows thats ok.
- Aim for the 15 reps on all movements but we can accept 12s if we start to fade.

B.3 Rounds For Time:
15 Barbell Seated Shoulder Press
12 1-Arm DB Rows (each arm)
10/8 Cal Erg
Scoring
Time Cap: 12 minutes
- If the high rep BB seated shoulder press is too challenging in terms of weight, scale that down to a DB if needed.
- Rows try to go heavy if we can.
C.Every minute for 9 minutes (3 rounds):
Minute 1
12 Dumbbell Zottman Curls
Minute 2
15 Banded Tricep Pushdowns
Minute 3
20 V-Ups

FIT
Log Result
Leaderboard
Phase 1: Week 3 (A)
4 alternating sets of:
A1.
4 Back Squats
- We used sets of 5 last week, so this is our chance to increase the weight on what we did last week.
- Leave some in the tank though, as we try to increase this across the cycle.
Rest as needed
A2.
8-12 Dual Dumbbell Seal Row (inline bench)s (3101 tempo)
- Rows continue this week, trying to build some upper-body muscle mass and strength.
Start a set every 3:30
B.AMRAP 18
100m - 200m - 300m - 400m ETC

Row
Ski

* After each set 40 DU / 60 Singles
Scoring
Reps (higher is better)
- A more aerobic focused session today.
- Try to hold onto the same pace the whole way through this. That means dont do you first 100m as though thats the workout, row the first 100m as though you are doing at least a 500m.

- Partner the class up and start at different ergs.
Show less

BURN
Log Result
Leaderboard
MOVE: Lower Body
A.For Time:
10 - 8 - 6 - 4

Front Foot Elevated Split Squats (each leg)

* After each set:

12 DB Deadlifts
10/8 Cal Erg
Scoring
Time Cap: 14 minutes
- Long stance and slight lean forward on the FFESS, pushing knee over toes.
- Keep the ergs at manageable paces.
- If you can hold your form, try for 1-2 weight increases on the split squats.
B.AMRAP 9
10 BB Cossack Squats
12 Elevated Heel Step downs (each leg)
6 Bupee to target
- Keep heels down on the cossacks.
- Keep the descent of the heel taps slow and smooth, a light tap.

Elevated heel step downs:
https://youtube.com/shorts/rZP1h96FDCE?si=Vtr8UjorkekB2hdh
C.EMOM x 9 (3 Rounds)
Min 1: 20 Russian Twists

Min 2: 15-20 Toe Touches

Min 3: 15 Plank Dips
- Think of this as a quality finisher, try to maintain good form under fatigue not just to hit the reps.
- Scale the volume down if you need to.
Show less

FIT
Log Result
Leaderboard
Phase 1: Week 3 (A)
3 alternating sets of:
A1.
8 Deadlifts
- Reps dropping from our last DL session.
- Working in sets of 8 today, try to increase on what we started but again keep this controlled as we are not trying to slam the bar off the ground.

Rest as needed
A2.
10 Shoulder Presses
- Reps are still high but dropping from 2 weeks ago.
- Still prioritising strength and muscle building.
Start a set every 3:30
B.As Many Rounds and Reps as possible in 6 minutes:
5 Alternating D-Ball Over Shoulders
10 Toes to Bars
15 Push-Ups
- Its only 6 minutes but there is more after this.
- Break up the TTBs and Push-ups as they will get harder and harder as the rounds go.
Rest 3 minutes
C.2 Rounds for Time:
10 Alternating D-Ball Over Shoulders
20 V-Ups
30 Push-Ups
Time Cap: 8 minutes
- This wont be easy to finish as you need to go faster than 4 minutes a round.
- Try to strong on the DBalls and don't lose your positions.
Show less

Warm Up
View Warm Up
A.1 Pause Clean Pull + 1 Hang Clean + 2 Front Squats
4 sets of @ 65-70%
Rest as needed
6.5-7RPE
- Pause to be done both below then above the knee for the pause clean pull.
- 2-3s pause at each postion.
B.Pause Push Jerk + Push Jerk
4 sets of 2 complexes
Rest as needed
6-6.5RPE
- Same as week 1.
- Tech focus for the day.
- 3s pause in the dip and another 3s pause in the catch position of the jerk.
- Work on finding a comfy re-racking of the bar.

3 alternating sets of:
C1.
10 Barbell Back Rack Reverse Lunges
7RPE
- 10/10 each leg for the lunge;
- 10-20 each side for the side planks with rotation.
Rest as needed

10-20 Side Plank with Rotations
Rest as needed

A.Every 4 minutes for 40 minutes (10 rounds):
Row 15/12 calories
40 Single Unders
Run 200 meters
10 Burpees over the Rower
* Cap these rounds at 3.30 to get some rest each round.

- This will test your ability to repeat efforts. So try to not go all out here and instead focus on moving well and if you need to bring any of the numbers down to make this more sustainable, that's ok.

LIFT
Log Result
Leaderboard
Phase 1 Week 3/A (Tech Focus)
Warm Up
View Warm Up
Set a Running clock for both A&B it should be a total of 15mins
A.Every 2 minutes, for 6 minutes (3 sets):
Hang Power Snatch + Hang Power To Squat
5-6RPE
Rest 1 min
B.Every 2 minutes, for 8 minutes (4 sets):
Pause Snatch + Snatch
6-7RPE
- Pause to be done above the knee.
- 2-3s Pause before going for the lift.
Set Running clock for both C&D. 15 Mins total
C.Every 2 minutes, for 6 minutes (3 sets):
Slow Pull Power Clean + Pause Clean + Jerk Drive + Jerk
6RPE
- Slow pull, Focus on the centre of mass, body/bar position.
- Pause clean, 3 options, these options varies depending on individual focus point.
Option 1 - Pause 1" off the ground.
Option 2 - Pause Above the knee.
Option 3 - Pause at the hip.
Rest 1 mins
D.Every 2 minutes, for 8 minutes (4 sets):
Power Clean and Jerk + Clean and Jerk
Build to a 7-8RPE

STEAM
Log Result
Leaderboard
Sunday Steam
In teams of 3:
A.AMRAP 15
20 - 40 - 60 - 80 ETC

Wall Balls
Cal Bike

* After each Round 200m Medball run (all 3)
Scoring
Reps (higher is better)
- Wall Balls and bike to be performed simultaneously so 1 partner on the wall balls / 1 partner on the bike / 1 partner resting.
- After both movements are finished all 3 will run together with a WB.
Rest 3 minutes
In teams of 3:
B.AMRAP 15
10/8 Cal Ski (each)
12 Synchro Jumping Lunges (all 3)
10 Synchro Single DB HC+J (all 3)
Scoring
Reps (higher is better)
- Ski to be done as a waterfall. Each person will finish 10/8 cals one after another until all 3 are finished, then move onto the lunges and DBs.
- DBs are done 5/5
Rest 3 minutes
In teams of 3:
C.For Time:
200/150 Cal Row

* Every switch person coming onto the rower needs to do 3 DBall Over the shoulders before starting.

Once all Cals are finished

50 Synchro Dball Squats (1 DBall, 2 Air Squat)
Scoring
Time (lower is better)
Time Cap: 15 minutes
- For the synchro squats 1 team member must be holing the Dball for the squats the other 2 will be air squatting, change the person holding the ball whenever you want, but ball cant hit the ground or else reps restart.

- I cant take credit for the squatting part.
Show less

Log Result
Leaderboard
MOVE: Full Body
A.Every 3:30 for 14 minutes (4 rounds):
12-15 Back Squats
12 Dual Dumbbell Shoulder Presses (3111 tempo)
Plank Hip Dips for 30 seconds
- Keep the back squats on the conservative side today and move through them focusing on full depth and good control.
- keep that tempo for the presses throughout.
B.For Time:
Buy In:

30 Rear Delt Flys

Into:

3 Rounds for time:

20 Curtsy Lunges
12/9 Cal Erg

Buy Out:

30 Rear Delt Flys
Scoring
Time Cap: 12 minutes
- Don't just rush through the rear delt flys. These should be hard enough that they cant be done in one set.
- Move well on the lunges (10 each leg) and then push pnly up to 75% on the ergs.

C.Every minute for 9 minutes (3 rounds):
Minute 1
15 Banded Lat Pulldowns
Minute 2
15-20 V-Ups
Minute 3
15 Cyclist Squats
- Cyclist squats to be done with a DBall.
- Lower reps for any of the movements if you need to.

Log Result
Leaderboard
Phase 1: Week 4 (B)
4 alternating sets of:
A1.
5 Barbell Bench Presses
Rest as needed
A2.
8-10 Strict Supinated Pull-Ups
- Upperbody strength and hypertrophy is a priority of this block as we try to build a stronger base for future cycles.
- Today we are trying to build to a heavy 5 rep on the bench across the 4 sets.
- Pull-ups can be assisted with a band or can be made harder with weight.
Start a set every 3 minutes
B.AMRAP 15
4 - 8 - 12 - 16 - 20 ETC

DBL KB Deadlifts (24/16)
Dual KB Hang Cleans (24/16)
V-Ups

* 30 DU / 45 Singles after each set
Scoring
Reps (higher is better)
- This is a long grindy piece today.
- Stay smart with the pacing at the start of this piece as that 15 minutes will feel like a loooong time.
- If you are not confident with the KB cleans, scale back the weight and try to move well.

Minutes 1:30 – 3:00

15 Banded Hamstring Curls

- Split Squats to be done as 10 each leg.
- Copenhagen plank is 30s each side. Support with the knee rather than the foot.
- RDLs are with a BB, keep these light and smooth.

8/10 Strict Knees to Elbows

A.Skill and Experiment
Beginner:

3-4 sets:

10 Seated Band Pull-downs (pause @ bottom)

20s Hollow Body Flutter Kicks

- Time Cap is tight so you'll need to move.
Rest 2 minutes
C.For Time:
30 Dual Dumbbell Box Step Overs @ 22.5/15 kg
Time Cap: 6 minutes
* Every break 3 Wall Walks

- A little finisher here, move strong and with purpose.
- A break is any time you put down the DBs

3 Clean Pulls
- Using 100-120% of your heaviest set from the complex today.
- Focus on good positions off the floor and moving well
